questions.question_text: Identify the Duty role that you need to associate with the Job role to enable the "new supplier request" functionality.

discussion.content: I was also sure about C .. but the oracle courses that show some questions including this one says D

choices.D: Online collaboration is visible only to the Requisition Preparer.
choices.C: The ‘Requirements and Instructions’ checkbox is unchecked in the style.
choices.B: The ‘Collaboration Team’ checkbox is unchecked in the style.
choices.A: Cost factors are not set up for negotiations for participants, causing no collaboration to negotiate cost.

questions.question_text: You have defined your negotiation style and named it ‘ABC negotiation style’. Subsequently, you try to add collaboration team members on a negotiation that is based on the ‘ABC negotiation style’ and find that the ‘Collaboration Team’ field is disabled. Identify the cause.

discussion.content: B is the correct answer. The ‘Collaboration Team’ checkbox is unchecked in the style.

Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer

comments.content: huh? i wish we had down-vote option. comment is NOT helpful.
There is a collaboration team check box, in the procurement offering under Sourcing Functional area search for Manage negotiation style, try to create one and you can enable or disable there
Not sure why people upvote the answer if they are not sure of the answer. This is a misleading answer. Please check this screenshot --> https://imgur.com/3Wztj5s

discussion.content: there is no collboration team check box. You either specify or leave the collaboration section empty.

questions.question_text:
While configuring offerings, you had deselected the "Supply Chain Financial Orchestration of Procurement Flows" check box and had locked the feature. However, because of changes in the business requirements, you are required to enable the feature.
Identify the prerequisite step to perform this change.

choices.A: Navigate to the "Select Feature Choices" page of the Procurement Offering and unlock the feature.
choices.B: Deselect the "Enable for Implementation" check box of the Procurement Offering.
choices.D: Change the Provisioned to "No" of the Procurement Offering.
choices.C: Set the implementation status to "In Progress" of the procurement Offering.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is the correct

choices.D: "Requisitioning Business Function Configuration" task of the Requisitioning BU
choices.B: supplier site assignment record of the supplier site in the Requisitioning BU
choices.C: BU assignment record of the source agreement that corresponds to the Requisitioning BU

questions.question_text: Which option would the application first look at to default the Location field in the Purchase Order Line?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A should be !

Correct answer is A.

 Location Default
 

 1> Header

 2> BU assignment record of the source agreement corresponding to the Requisitioning BU

 3> Supplier Site Assignment record of the supplier site in the Requisitioning BU

 4> Requisitioning Business Function Configuration of the Requisitioning BU

Requisition Self Service User

Manages requisitions including creating, searching, and viewing requisitions, creating noncatalog requests, creating requisitions with one-time locations, and changing deliver-to locations on requisition lines.

As per docs even Prepare can create requisition.

questions.question_text:
Your customer is implementing Oracle Procurement Cloud applications with multiple Requisition Business Units. Each Business Unit has employees who need the ability to create requisitions. The customer does not want all employees in the organization to be able to create requisitions using the self-service application; however, they should be able to search for information (for example, contact details) relating to other employees.
To restrict certain employees from being able to create requisitions, identify the inherited role that must be removed from the seeded Employee role.
